meanings.definition: A person or thing that is particularly impressive or outstanding.
meanings.sent1: The new roller coaster at the theme park is a real showstopper.
meanings.sent2: The singer's powerful voice was the showstopper of the concert.
meanings.sent3: The giant cake at the party was such a showstopper that everyone wanted a piece.
meanings.sent4: Her stunning dress was a showstopper, drawing all eyes to her at the event.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display on New Year's Eve was a showstopper, lighting up the sky with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: An event or performance that is so impressive or entertaining that it temporarily stops the show.
meanings.sent1: The magician's disappearing act was a showstopper at the talent show.
meanings.sent2: The dance routine in the musical was the ultimate showstopper of the night.
meanings.sent3: The clown's hilarious antics turned into a showstopper when he accidentally slipped on a banana peel.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie was a showstopper, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The acrobatic performance by the circus troupe was a showstopper, leaving the crowd cheering for more.
